name: empty
purpose: Determine whether a variable is empty

return.description:
Returns FALSE if var has a non-empty
   and non-zero value.The following things are considered to be empty:
   
    "" (an empty string)
    0 (0 as an integer)
    "0" (0 as a string)
    NULL
    FALSE
    array() (an empty array)
    var $var; (a variable declared, but without a value in a class)

notes.description:
Because this is a
language construct and not a function, it cannot be called using
variable functions

When using empty on inaccessible object properties,
    the __isset
    overloading method will be called, if declared.

changelog.change: As of PHP 5, objects with no properties are no longer considered empty.
